bioghist.p: Dr. Martin Christadler was on the faculty of the University of Tubingen and Marieluise Christadler was a teacher of civics in secondary schools. The couple came to Philadelphia in 1965 as fellows in American Studies under the American Council of Learned Societies. Dr. Christadler was doing research on the American essay of the 18th and 19th centuries. Mrs. Christadler was interested in the Civil Rights movement.

scopecontent.p: This is a scrapbook of photographs and text excerpts from writings about Philadelphia and Pennsylvania. The volume is arranged into thematic sections with titles such as "Variety and Gigantism in Philadelphia," Des Freres Qui Vivent Ensemble," "Des Freres Qui Vivent Seuls," "No Need for Police," "Negroes in Philadelphia," and "Pleasures of the Table." Topics include views of American Indians, William Penn's "holy experiment", crime, Quakers, Franklin, and Philadelphia architecture. Most of the photos are black and white. Text excerpts are in English, French, and German.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
